description: The couple stirred debate last fall when one of them questioned a university email warning against potentially offensive Halloween costumes.
title: Yale Professor and Wife, Targets of Protests, Resign as College Heads
title_page: Yale Professor and Wife, Targets of Protests, Resign as College Heads - The New York Times
maintext:
A Yale professor and his wife who became targets of protests for an email about potentially offensive Halloween costumes are resigning their positions as heads of a residential community at the university.
The professor, Nicholas Christakis, a sociologist and physician, announced on his Twitter feed Wednesday that he was stepping down as head of Silliman College, a residence where he and his wife served as social and intellectual mentors to students.
Dr. Christakis, who directs Yaleâ€™s Human Nature Lab, said they were not severing all their ties to the university. He will stay on as a tenured professor. His wife, Erika Christakis, who recently published a book about preschool, will continue her work in that field, he said, though he did not specify in what capacity. The resignations are effective in July.
